alert.note: Alert for Rockingham; Stokes (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 2:27PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Stokes, northwestern Rockingham, southern Henry and southeastern Patrick Counties and the City of Martinsville through 300 PM EDT... At 226 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Penns Store, or over Spencer, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Eden... Martinsville... Spencer... Sandy Ridge... Ridgeway... Villa Heights... and Chatmoss. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
